About the Council
-----------------

All powers of the City and the determination of all matters of policy are vested in City Council. The Council executes the laws and administers the government of the City. The Mayor and the two councilpersons-at-large are elected by a majority vote of the qualified voters of the city at large. The city is divided into six districts and one councilperson is elected from each district by majority vote of the resident voters of the district. The Mayor and Councilpersons hold their respective offices for a term of three years or until their successors have been elected and duly qualified. The positions of Mayor and Councilpersons Districts 2 and 3 will be elected next in 2027 and 2030; Councilperson At-Large Position A and Districts 4 and 5 in 2025 and 2028; and Councilperson At-Large Position B and Districts 1 and 6 in 2026 and 2029.

Agendas & Minutes
-----------------

The City Council meets the 2nd and 4th Mondays of the month at 6:00 p.m. To view the most recent agendas and minutes, [view the archive](http://tx-laporte.civicplus.com/Archive.aspx?AMID=62). Council meeting video is available at [LaPorteTX.gov/MeetingVideo](//LaPorteTX.gov/MeetingVideo). To search and/or view past meeting agendas and minutes and historical records, visit the public portal at [LaPorteTX.gov/SearchRecords](http://publicrecords.laportetx.gov/weblink8/Browse.aspx).
